page.title: 02FARMING LIFE IN BIBURY
page.content: Winter wheat is the main crop grown in this area with a small percentage of winter and spring barley, and a few crops of oilseed rape and peas. Live stock is mostly beef and sheep. In years gone by Bibury had two main land owners and the river divided them, the one side being, and still is, known as Arlington. This land was let to "tenant" farmers. These are now dying out and the land is gradually being sold off to land owners. There are very few farm workers employed on a farm, compared to fifty years ago. Agriculteral contractors are being used a lot on the farm due to the high cost of farm machinery.
